com.mycompany.myapp

Class GameWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mycompany.myapp.GameWorld

  • public class GameWorld
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Charles Levinsky

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameWorld() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAstroid()
      'a' - creates new Asteroid with random location, direction, size, and speed
      void addShip()
      's' - creates new Ship with initial location at center of screen, direction and speed of 0 only one Ship at allowed at a time
      void addStation()
      'b' - creates new SpaceStation with unique id and random location and blink rate
      void clockTick()
      't' - increment time by one, update GameObjects update location of all Movable objects decrement fuel on all Missiles toggle lights on SpaceStations (based on rate)
      void crash()
      'c' - Ship crashes into Asteroid, both destroyed removes one Ship and one Asteroid from GameWorld if lives remain, decrements lives otherwise game over
      void decSpeed()
      'd' - decrease Ship speed by 1 min of 0
      void extrmnt()
      'x' - two Asteroids collide, both destroyed removes 2 asteroids from GameWorld
      void fire()
      'f' - creates a new Missile initial location = Ship location
      int getScore() 
      double getSizeX() 
      double getSizeY() 
      void incSpeed()
      'i' - increase Ship speed by 1 max of 10
      void init()
      builds default GameWorld state
      void jump()
      'j' - moves Ship to starting position
      void killAstrd()
      'k' - destroys an Asteroid with a Missile remove's one Asteroid and one Missile object adds 100 points to score
      void print()
      'p' - prints GameWorld stats to console score, missiles remaining, and game time
      void printMap()
      'm' - prints state of all GameObjects location, speed, direction, color, etc of all concrete objects
      void quit()
      'q' - quits the game asks for confirmation first
      void resupply()
      'n' - sets Ship's missile count back to starting value (10)
      void setScore(int score) 
      void turnLeft()
      'l' - changes Ship direction by -10 once 0 is reached, next increment will change to 350
      void turnRight()
      'r' - changes Ship direction by 10 once 350 is reached, next increment will change to 0

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
